item.title: Melissa add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Melissa add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "If there is no love in the world, we will make a new world, and we will give it walls, and we will furnish it with soft, red interiors, from the inside out, and give it a knocker that resonates like a diamond falling to a jeweller's felt so that we should never hear it. Love me, because love doesn't exist, and I have tried everything that does." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
Melissa add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "What you risk reveals what you value." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Long looking at paintings is equivalent to being dropped into a foreign city, where gradually, out of desire and despair, a few key words, then a little syntax make a clearing in the silence. Art... is a foreign city, and we deceive ourselves when we think it familiar... We have to recognize that the language of art, all art, is not our mother-tongue." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I have a theory that every time you make an important choice, the part of you left behind continues the other life you could have had." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "[N]othing is as surprising as life. Except for writing. Except for writing. Yes, of course, except for writing, the only consolation." -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "Still, there are times I am bewildered by each mile I have traveled, each meal I have eaten, each person I have known, each room in which I have slept. As ordinary as it all appears, there are times when it is beyond my imagination." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "Things can change in a day." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "Being with him made her feel as though her soul had escaped from the narrow confines of her island country into the vast, extravagant spaces of his. He made her feel as though the world belonged to them- as though it lay before them like an opened frog on a dissecting table, begging to be examined." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Maureen Dowd
item.description: "The minute you settle for less than you deserve, you get even less than you settled for. " -- Maureen Dowd

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "If you are a dreamer come in If you are a dreamer a wisher a liar A hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyer If youre a pretender com sit by my fire For we have some flax golden tales to spin Come in! Come in!" -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "Interpretation is the revenge of the intellectual upon art. " -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "Do stuff. be clenched, curious. Not waiting for inspiration's shove or society's kiss on your forehead. Pay attention. It's all about paying attention. attention is vitality. It connects you with others. It makes you eager. stay eager." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "The likelihood that your acts of resistance cannot stop the injustice does not exempt you from acting in what you sincerely and reflectively hold to be the best interests of your community." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description:
"The only interesting answers are those which destroy the questions.
" -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "They sicken of the calm who know the storm." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Janet Fitch
